personal.name: Bruno Maciel Servulo
personal.title: Senior Software Engineer - Dynamics 365 and Azure

professional_summary: Senior Software Engineer and CRM Architect with 10+ years of experience designing and delivering enterprise-scale Microsoft Dynamics 365, Power Platform, and Azure integration solutions. Proven track record delivering high-availability systems for 10,000+ user bases with complex integrations across financial services, manufacturing, retail, education, and government sectors. Expert in scalable architecture, system reliability, and delivery in regulated environments. Strong background in C#, .NET, Azure cloud services, and enterprise CRM implementations.

primary_technologies: Power Platform (Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI, Power Pages)
Azure Cloud Services (Functions, Logic Apps, Service Bus, API Management)

Microsoft Dynamics 365.description: Comprehensive expertise in the Dynamics 365 suite including Sales, Customer Service, Field Service, and Customer Insights. Deep knowledge of configuration, customization, and integration patterns.

Dynamics 365.description: Suite of intelligent business applications for CRM and relationship management.

Dynamics 365 Sales.description: Sales force automation to manage relationships and close deals faster.

Dynamics 365 Customer Service.description: Support solutions to drive customer satisfaction and loyalty.

Dynamics 365 Field Service.description: End-to-end management for on-site service operations and scheduling.

Dynamics 365 Customer Insights.description: Unified customer data platform (CDP) and journey orchestration.

Dynamics CRM.description: Legacy Microsoft Dynamics CRM platform (2011-2016) for customer relationship management.

Dynamics CRM 2011.description: Microsoft Dynamics CRM 2011 version for customer relationship management.

Power Platform.description: Advanced skills in Power Apps (Canvas & Model-Driven), Power Automate, Power BI, and Power Pages. Expert in low-code/no-code solutions and custom component development.

Power Apps.description: Suite for building custom low-code/no-code business applications.

Power Automate.description: Service to automate workflows between apps and services.

Power BI.description: Business analytics service for interactive visualizations and BI.

Power Apps Portals.description: External-facing websites for users outside the organization (now Power Pages).

Power Pages.description: Low-code platform for building external-facing websites and portals.

Custom Connectors.description: Wrappers around APIs to communicate with Logic Apps and Power Automate.

PCF Components.description: Power Apps Component Framework for creating custom UI controls.

Canvas Apps.description: UI-focused apps with pixel-perfect control over the layout.

Model-Driven Apps.description: Component-focused apps design offering rich business logic and data modeling.

Microsoft Dataverse.description: Secure, scalable data platform for Power Platform and Dynamics 365.

Azure Cloud Services.description: Proficient in Azure services including Logic Apps, Functions, Service Bus, API Management, DevOps, and App Services. Experience designing cloud-native and hybrid solutions.

Azure.description: Microsoft's cloud computing platform for building, deploying, and managing applications.

Azure Logic Apps.description: Cloud service to schedule, automate, and orchestrate tasks and workflows.

Azure Functions.description: Serverless compute service to run event-triggered code without infrastructure.

Azure Service Bus.description: Enterprise message broker for decoupling applications and services.

Azure API Management.description: Platform to create, publish, maintain, monitor, and secure APIs.

Azure DevOps.description: Services for teams to share code, track work, and ship software.

Azure App Services.description: HTTP-based service for hosting web applications, REST APIs, and mobile back ends.

Azure Blob Storage.description: Massively scalable object storage for unstructured data.

C# and .NET Development.description: Advanced development capabilities in C#, .NET, JavaScript, TypeScript, and React. Experience building plugins, custom workflows, PCF components, and web resources.

C#.description: Modern, object-oriented, type-safe programming language for .NET.

.NET Framework.description: Development framework for building apps on Windows.

.NET.description: Microsoft's free, open-source development platform for building many types of applications.

.NET Core.description: Cross-platform, high-performance framework for modern cloud-enabled apps.

JavaScript.description: High-level, interpreted scripting language for web pages.

TypeScript.description: Superset of JavaScript adding static type definitions.

React.description: JavaScript library for building user interfaces.

HTML.description: Standard markup language for documents designed to be displayed in a web browser.

HTML Canvas.description: HTML element for drawing graphics via JavaScript.

CSS.description: Style sheet language used for describing the presentation of a document.

SQL Server.description: Relational database management system developed by Microsoft.

SQL Server Reporting Services.description: Server-based report generation software system from Microsoft.

T-SQL.description: Proprietary extension to SQL for SQL Server interaction.

Web API.description: Framework for building HTTP services that reach a broad range of clients.

REST API.description: Architectural style for designing networked applications.

ASP.NET MVC 4.description: Model-View-Controller framework for building web applications.

Plugin Development.description: Custom business logic execution within the Dynamics 365 event pipeline.

System Integration.description: Proven track record in integrating Dynamics 365 with various systems including SAP, legacy applications, and third-party services using REST APIs, OData, and middleware.

API Integration.description: Connecting systems via Application Programming Interfaces.

SAP Integration.description: Connecting Microsoft ecosystem with SAP ERP modules.

ERP Integration.description: Synchronizing data between CRM and Enterprise Resource Planning systems.

SharePoint.description: Microsoft's web-based collaborative platform for document management and storage.

Middleware Development.description: Software connecting different applications or services.

ETL Processes.description: Extract, Transform, Load data integration processes.

Real-time Data Synchronization.description: Immediate data consistency across multiple systems.

Legacy System Integration.description: Connecting modern apps with older, established systems.

Integration.description: Connecting and synchronizing different systems and applications.

Integration Architecture.description: Designing patterns and strategies for system integration.

Web Portals.description: External-facing websites for customer and partner engagement.

Digital Signatures.description: Electronic authentication and document signing mechanisms.

Database Modeling.description: Designing and structuring database schemas and relationships.

Enterprise Architecture.description: Skills in designing scalable, secure, and maintainable enterprise solutions that align with business objectives and technical best practices.

Solution Architecture.description: Designing comprehensive solutions that balance business requirements, technical constraints, performance, security, and maintainability.

Technical Leadership.description: Leading development teams, mentoring junior developers, conducting code reviews, and establishing best practices and architectural standards.

CRM Implementation.description: Expertise in managing complete CRM project lifecycles, from requirements gathering and solution design through development, testing, deployment, and user adoption.

Custom Development.description: Building tailored solutions and extensions for specific business needs.

CRM Configuration.description: Configuring and customizing CRM systems without code.

Cloud Migration.description: Moving applications and data from on-premises to cloud infrastructure.

Performance Optimization.description: Identifying and resolving performance bottlenecks, optimizing queries, implementing caching strategies.

Agile.description: Iterative approach to project management and software development.

Scrum.description: Framework for developing, delivering, and sustaining complex products.

DevOps.description: Practices combining software development and IT operations.

Test-Driven Development.description: Software development process relying on software requirements being converted to test cases.

Code Reviews.description: Systematic examination of computer source code.

Technical Team Leadership.description: Guiding technical teams towards successful delivery.

Client Workshops.description: Collaborative sessions to define requirements and solutions.

Stakeholder Management.description: Maintaining relationships with project investors and users.

Solution Design.description: Defining the architecture and components of a solution.

Project Rescue.description: Recovering failing projects through technical intervention.

Sales Forecasting.description: Predicting future sales using data analysis and CRM tools.
